alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:00PM EST until January 10 at 7:20AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding will expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Most of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be under a foot or two of water. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around three feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around four feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Tuesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 1.5 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 03/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 730 AM EST.
